title: How to configure macOS for Raspberry Pi 4 - Quora

response.answer_text: RPi4 with qemu emulating x86 instructions ? If so, I think that it might be doable (to some extent) but with a *lot* of effort, reading and experimentation and still in the end may not be a *usable* MacOS setup. It may be so slow that you might ditch it before it boots and presents the desktop. I had Mojave running in Virtualbox VM with 4GB RAM and 4 vCPUs on Linux host on an Intel i5–8400, and it was far from being very smooth.

MacOS being an intensive OS compared to other Linux versions cannot be recommended for raspberry pi. Also it's not possible due to different CPU architectures. MacOS uses x64 whereas rpi is ARM. I'd recommend Ubuntu or another flavour of it instead.
